result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica M Hendricks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact w/victims family
No cell phone use unless approved by agent

Counseling deemed necessary
Maintain full time employement
4 times per year, while on extended supervision and probation, to give speach at a high school regarding texting and driving

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF344

Defendant Jessica M Hendricks in court with attorney Jessica Shank Phelps and Attorney Emily Nolan Plutchak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury trial - 12 person on May 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.
for Preliminary Hearing held January 22, 2016.  (Kimberly R. Collins, Court Reporter)

Defendant Jessica M Hendricks in court with attorney Jessica Shank Phelps.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Investigator Scott Machotka is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to investigating a crash in the Town of Port Edwards.  Testifies to his findings at the scene and identifies the name of the victim.  Testifies to speaking with the defendant regarding the crash.  Testifies that defendant told him she was looking at text messages on her cellphone at the time of the crash. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Cross-examination by Attorney Nolan-Plutchak.  Questions witness regarding specifics of the crash.  Testifies to his contact with the defendant.  Re-direct by Attorney Lambert. Re-cross by Attorney Nolan-Plutchak.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant brings a motion to have the no contact with the deceased victim's former residence be lifted.  State does not oppose.  Court approves and orders no contact with victims family and their residences.
